TEXT.English: Terra sigillata is a term with at least three distinct meanings: as a description of medieval medicinal earth; in archaeology, as a general term for some of the fine red Ancient Roman pottery with glossy surface slips made in specific areas of the Roman Empire; and more recently, as a description of a contemporary studio pottery technique supposedly inspired by ancient pottery. Usually roughly translated as 'sealed earth', the meaning of 'terra sigillata' is 'clay bearing little images' (Latin sigilla), not 'clay with a sealed (impervious) surface'. The archaeological term is applied, however, to plain-surfaced pots as well as those decorated with figures in relief.

In geometry, the tesseract is the four-dimensional analog of the cube; the tesseract is to the cube as the cube is to the square. Just as the surface of the cube consists of six square faces, the hypersurface of the tesseract consists of eight cubical cells. The tesseract is one of the six convex regular 4-polytopes.

A time crystal, or space-time crystal, is a structure that repeats in time as well as in space. Normal three-dimensional crystals have a repeating pattern in space, but remain unchanged as time passes. Time crystals repeat themselves in time as well, leading the crystal to change from moment to moment. If a discrete time translation symmetry is broken (which may be realized in open driven systems), then the system is referred to as a discrete time crystal. A discrete time crystal never reaches thermal equilibrium, as it is a type of non-equilibrium matter (a form of matter first observed in 2017).
TEXT.Italian: Un cristallo del tempo, o cristallo spazio-temporale, è una struttura che si ripete nel tempo e nello spazio. I normali cristalli tridimensionali hanno una struttura che si ripete nello spazio, ma che rimane invariata nel tempo. I cristalli del tempo si ripetono anche nel tempo, portando il cristallo a cambiare di momento in momento. Se una simmetria di traslazione temporale discreta viene interrotta (come può avvenire in sistemi a guida aperta), il sistema viene chiamato "cristallo temporale discreto". Un cristallo temporale discreto non raggiunge mai l'equilibrio termico, in quanto è un tipo di materia di non-equilibrio (una forma di materia osservata per la prima volta nel 2017).

TEXT.English: Tin is a silvery metal with a characteristically faint yellow hue, obtained chiefly from cassiterite. The first tin alloy used on a large scale was bronze, made of 1/8 tin and 7/8 copper, from as early as 3000 BC. After 600 BC, pure metallic tin was produced. Pewter, which is an alloy of 85–90% tin with the remainder commonly consisting of copper, antimony, and lead, was used for flatware from the Bronze Age until the 20th century. In modern times, tin is used in many alloys, most notably tin/lead soft solders and in the manufacture of transparent, electrically conducting films of indium tin oxide in optoelectronic applications. Another large application for tin is corrosion-resistant tin plating of steel. Because of the low toxicity of inorganic tin, tin-plated steel is widely used for food packaging as tin cans. However, some organotin compounds can be almost as toxic as cyanide.
TEXT.Italian: Lo stagno è un metallo argenteo con una caratteristica tonalità giallo tenue, ottenuto principalmente dalla cassiterite. La prima lega di stagno usata su larga scala fu il bronzo, fatto di 1/8 di stagno e 7/8 di rame, già nel 3000 a.C. Dopo il 600 a.C., iniziò la produzione di latta metallica pura. Il peltro, che è una lega all'85-90% di stagno, con il resto costituito comunemente da rame, antimonio e piombo, è stato utilizzato per le posate dall'età del bronzo fino al XX secolo. Nei tempi moderni, lo stagno viene utilizzato in molte leghe, in particolare nelle saldature di stagno e piombo e nella produzione di pellicole trasparenti a conduzione elettrica di ossido di indio-stagno per applicazioni optoelettroniche. Lo stagno viene utilizzato ampiamente anche nella placcatura dell'acciaio, per renderlo resistente alla corrosione. A causa della sua bassa tossicità, l'acciaio stagnato è ampiamente utilizzato per il cibo in lattine. Tuttavia, alcuni composti di organotina possono essere tossici quasi quanto il cianuro.

TEXT.English: The fundamental materials of modern tires are synthetic rubber, natural rubber, fabric and wire, along with other compound chemicals. They consist of a tread and a body. The tread provides traction while the body ensures support.
TEXT.Italian: I materiali base dei pneumatici moderni sono gomma sintetica, gomma naturale, tessuto e fili, oltre ad altri prodotti chimici. Hanno un'anima e un corpo; l'anima fornisce trazione, mentre il corpo fornisce supporto.
TEXT.Polish: Opona pneumatyczna - zewnętrzna część koła o przekroju otwartym, nakładana na felgę lub obręcz i wypełniana powietrzem (lub innym gazem) pod ciśnieniem. Jest elementem pojazdu kontaktującym się z podłożem, zapewnia przenoszenie ciężaru pojazdu, sił napędu, hamowania i skrętu, a także podstawową amortyzację w czasie jazdy.

TEXT.English: Titanium is a precious metal. Titanium is Sometimes called the "space age" metal, as it is corrosion-resistant and has the highest strength-to-weight ratio of any metal. Titanium can be alloyed with iron, aluminium, vanadium, molybdenum, among other elements, to produce strong lightweight alloys for aerospace (jet engines, missiles, and spacecraft), military, industrial process (chemicals and petro-chemicals, desalination plants, pulp, and paper), automotive, agri-food, medical prostheses, orthopaedic implants, dental and endodontic instruments and files, dental implants, sporting goods, jewellery, mobile phones, and other applications. Titanium was discovered in England by William Gregor in 1791 and named by Martin Heinrich Klaproth for the Titans of Greek mythology.
TEXT.Polish: Tytan jest metalem szlachetnym. Tytan jest czasami nazywany "ery kosmicznej" metalu, ponieważ jest odporny na korozję i ma najwyższy stosunek wytrzymałości do masy dowolnego metalu. Tytan może być stopiony z żelaza, aluminium, wanad, molibden, między innymi elementami, do produkcji stopów lekkich do mocnych lotniczym (silniki odrzutowe, rakiet kosmicznych), oraz, wojsko, procesów przemysłowych (chemikalia i Petro-chemicznych, zakładów odsalania wody, masy celulozowej, i papier), motoryzacyjny, rolno-spożywczy, protezy medyczne, implantów ortopedycznych, instrumenty i pliki stomatologiczne i endodontyczne, implanty stomatologiczne, artykuły sportowe, biżuteria, telefony komórkowe i inne aplikacje. Tytan został odkryty w Anglii przez Williama Gregora w 1791 roku i nazwany przez Martina Heinricha Klaproth dla tytanów z mitologii greckiej.

TEXT.English: It is believed that tobacco began growing in the Americas about 6,000 BCE, and by 1 BCE Native Americans were using tobacco in spiritual rituals and social gatherings. On October 15, 1492 Columbus was presented with a gift of dried tobacco leaves by the Native Americans. Soon after, it was brought to Europe where its popularity soared as people thought it cured everything from bad breath to cancer. The opposite, of course, was true. In 1847 Phillip Morris established selling hand rolled Turkish cigarettes. Cigarettes have served in every war since WW I, and have become entwined with images of war in the modern era. The active ingredient, Nicotine, is a highly toxic liquid alkaloid which has since been recognized as severely detrimental to health. The neuro-depressant is highly addictive, and also suppresses appetite while increasing blood pressure. New users experience a "high," while experienced users feel simple satisfaction.
TEXT.French: On croit que le tabac a commencé à pousser en Amériques environ 6.000 avant J.C., et au premier siècle, les Américains indigènes employaient le tabac dans des rituels spirituels et des rassemblements sociaux. Le 15 octobre 1492, Christophe Colomb a été présenté avec un cadeau des feuilles sèches de tabac par les Américains indigènes. Peu après, il a été apporté à l'Europe où sa popularité a monté comme les gens ont pensé qu'elle a traité tout du mauvais souffle au cancer. L'opposé, naturellement, était vrai. En Phillip 1847 Morris a établi vendre la main les cigarettes turques roulées. Les cigarettes ont servi dans chaque guerre depuis WW I, et sont devenues enlacerées avec des images de guerre dans l'ère moderne. La substance active, nicotine, est un alcaloïde liquide fortement toxique qui a été depuis identifié comme sévèrement nuisible à la santé. Le neuro--dépresseur est fortement provoquant une dépendance, et supprime également l'appétit tout en augmentant la tension artérielle. Les nouveaux utilisateurs éprouvent une "haute," tandis que les utilisateurs expérimentés sentent la satisfaction simple.

TEXT.English: A stone tool is, in the most general sense, any tool made either partially or entirely out of stone. Although stone tool-dependent societies and cultures still exist today, most stone tools are associated with prehistoric, particularly Stone Age cultures that have become extinct.
TEXT.Polish: Narzędzie - przedmiot lub urządzenie służące do bezpośredniego oddziaływania w procesie pracy na przedmiot pracy stanowiące wyposażenie człowieka lub maszyny. Większość prostych narzędzi jest maszynami prostymi. Narzędzie pozwala wykonać to, czego przeciętny człowiek nie byłby w stanie wykonać "gołymi rękami", lub ułatwia to, co może wykonać sam. Narzędziami posługują się też niektóre gatunki zwierząt.

TEXT.English: A toy is any object that can be used for play. Toys are associated commonly with children and pets. Playing with toys is often thought to be an enjoyable means of training the young for life in human society. Many items are designed to serve as toys, but goods produced for other purposes can also be used.
TEXT.Italian: Un giocattolo è qualunque oggetto che può essere usato per giocare. I giocattoli vengono generalmetne associati con i bambini e gli animali da compagnia. I giocattoli sono ritenuti un ottimo mezzo educativo nella società umana; molti oggetti vengono creati come giocattoli, ma anche altri oggetti normali possono essere usati per giocare.
TEXT.Polish: Zabawka - Jest przedmiotem wykorzystywanym głównie przez małe dzieci do gry i zabawy. Zabawka posiada wiele form np. lalki, samochody, domki, meble czy zwierzęta. Głównym założeniem zabawki jest szkolenie młodych ludzi do życia w społeczeństwie. Materiały z jakich wytwarzane są zabawki są odpowiednio dobierane do celów zabawki oraz wieku dziecka. Zabawki wspomagają rozwój dziecka już od pierwszych miesięcy jego życia.

TEXT.English: A transistor is a semiconductor device used to amplify and switch electronic signals and electrical power. It is composed of semiconductor material with at least three terminals for connection to an external circuit. A voltage or current applied to one pair of the transistor's terminals changes the current through another pair of terminals. Because the controlled (output) power can be higher than the controlling (input) power, a transistor can amplify a signal. Today, some transistors are packaged individually, but many more are found embedded in integrated circuits.
TEXT.Polish: Tranzystor - trójelektrodowy (rzadko czteroelektrodowy) półprzewodnikowy element elektroniczny, posiadający zdolność wzmacniania sygnału elektrycznego. Nazwa urządzenia wywodzi się od słów transkonduktancja(transconductance) z "półprzewodnikowym" przyrostkiem -stor jak w warystor.

TEXT.English: Transparent aluminum is mass production of transparent aluminum oxide ceramics. Applications include electronic displays, construction, and shielding of military vehicles.
Tungsten is a very important metal for military applications.
TEXT.Spanish: El tungsteno es un metal muy importante para aplicaciones militares.
TEXT.Polish: Wolfram (W, łac. wolframium) - pierwiastek chemiczny z grupy metali przejściowych w układzie okresowym. Nazwa pochodzi od wolframitu, minerału, z którego wolfram został wyodrębniony po raz pierwszy. Dawna nazwa polska tungsten pochodzi od szwedzkich słów tung ("ciężki") i sten ("kamień"); nazwa o takiej etymologii używana jest współcześnie w języku angielskim, francuskim i niektórych innych.

TEXT.English: Turquoise is an opaque, blue-to-green mineral that is a hydrous phosphate of copper and aluminium. It is rare and valuable in finer grades and has been prized as a gem and ornamental stone for thousands of years owing to its unique hue.

A typewriter is a mechanical or electromechanical machine for writing in characters similar to those produced by printer's type by means of keyboard-operated types striking a ribbon to transfer ink or carbon impressions onto the paper. Typically one character is printed per keypress. The machine prints characters by making ink impressions of type elements similar to the sorts used in movable type letterpress printing. After their invention in the 1860s, typewriters quickly became indispensable tools for practically all writing other than personal correspondence. They were widely used by professional writers, in offices, and for business correspondence in private homes. By the end of the 1980s, word processors and personal computers had largely displaced typewriters in most of these uses in the Western world, but as of the 2010s the typewriter is still prominent in many parts of the world including India.
TEXT.Polish: Maszyna do pisania - urządzenie mechaniczne o napędzie ręcznym lub elektrycznym, posiadające klawisze, które naciskane powodują wydrukowanie metodą typograficzną określonych znaków na umieszczonym w maszynie podłożu drukowym (najczęściej papierze). Urządzenie może być również wspomagane modułem elektronicznym umożliwiającym zapamiętywanie wpisywanego tekstu.

TEXT.English: Ultrafuel is a highly adaptive fuel product that can be specifically designed for any range of fuel needs (from solid fuel to liquid, to gas), with any designated degree of flamability, flash point, and durability. The pinnacle of genetically enhanced crops and biofuel chemistry, it has made completely obsolete any kind of fossil fuel. It is used in shockwave engines as a catalyst fuel, as well as primary power source for many kind of air and space vehicles.
TEXT.Italian: L'ultracarburante è un carburante altamente adattivo che può essere progettato specificamente per qualsiasi gamma di esigenze di carburante (dal combustibile solido al liquido, al gas), con qualsiasi grado designato di infiammabilità, punto di infiammabilità e durata. Il picco della combinazione fra colture geneticamente migliorate e chimica dei biocarburanti, ha reso completamente obsoleto qualsiasi tipo di combustibile fossile. È utilizzato nei motori a onda d'urto come combustibile catalizzatore, nonché come fonte di energia primaria per molti tipi di veicoli aerei e spaziali.

TEXT.English: An unmanned aircraft, commonly known as drone or UAV, is an aircraft without a human pilot on board and a type of unmanned vehicle. It is composed by a vehicle, a ground-based controller, and a system of communications between the two. The flight of UAVs may operate with various degrees of autonomy: either under remote control by a human operator or autonomously by onboard computers. While they originated mostly in military applications, their use is rapidly expanding to commercial, scientific, recreational, agricultural, and other applications, such as policing and surveillance, product deliveries, aerial photography, infrastructure inspections, smuggling, and drone racing.
TEXT.Italian: Un velivolo senza pilota, comunemente noto come drone o UAV, è un velivolo senza un pilota umano a bordo e un tipo di veicolo senza pilota. È composto da un veicolo, un controller a terra e un sistema di comunicazione tra i due. Il volo degli UAV può operare con vari gradi di autonomia: sotto controllo remoto da parte di un operatore umano o autonomamente tramite un computer di bordo. Sebbene abbiano avuto originariamente applicazioni militari, il loro uso si sta rapidamente espandendo in applicazioni commerciali, scientifiche, ricreative, agricole e di altro tipo, come polizia e sorveglianza, consegne di prodotti, fotografia aerea, ispezioni delle infrastrutture, contrabbando e corse di droni.

TEXT.English: Unobtainium is any hypothetical, fictional, extremely rare, costly, or impossible material. Less commonly, it can refer to a device with desirable engineering properties for an application, but which are difficult or impossible to achieve. The properties of any particular unobtainium depend on the intended use. The concept of unobtainium is often applied hand-waving flippantly or humorously.
TEXT.Italian: L'unobtainio (anche inottenio) è qualsiasi materiale ipotetico, immaginario, estremamente raro, costoso o impossibile. Meno comunemente, può fare riferimento a un dispositivo con proprietà ingegneristiche desiderabili per un'applicazione, ma che sono difficili o impossibili da raggiungere. Le proprietà di ogni particolare unobtainio dipendono dall'uso previsto. Il concetto viene spesso applicato agitando le mani in modo irriverente o umoristico.

TEXT.English: Uranium is a silvery-grey, weakly radioactive metal. All known uranium isotopes are unstable: the half-lives of its naturally occurring isotopes range between 159,200 years and 4.5 billion years. The most common isotopes are uranium-238 (which accounts for over 99% of uranium on Earth) and uranium-235. The latter is the only naturally occurring fissile isotope, which makes it widely used in nuclear power plants and nuclear weapons after being treated with a process called "enrichment". In sufficient concentration, these isotopes maintain a sustained nuclear chain reaction. This generates the heat in nuclear power reactors, and produces the fissile material for nuclear weapons. Depleted uranium (238U) is used in kinetic energy penetrators and armor plating.
TEXT.Italian: L'uranio è un metallo grigio-argenteo debolmente radioattivo. Tutti gli isotopi di uranio noti sono instabili: le emivite degli isotopi presenti in natura variano tra 159.200 anni e 4,5 miliardi di anni. Gli isotopi più comuni sono l'uranio-238 (che rappresenta oltre il 99% dell'uranio sulla Terra) e l'uranio-235. Quest'ultimo è l'unico isotopo fissile presente in natura, che lo rende ampiamente usato nelle centrali nucleari e nelle armi nucleari dopo essere stato trattato con un processo chiamato "arricchimento". In una concentrazione sufficiente, questi isotopi mantengono una reazione a catena nucleare sostenuta. Ciò genera il calore nei reattori nucleari e produce materiale fissile per le armi nucleari. L'uranio impoverito (238U) viene utilizzato nei penetratori di energia cinetica e nella placcatura delle armature.

TEXT.English: A vacuum cleaner, also known simply as a vacuum, is a device that causes suction in order to remove debris from floors, upholstery, draperies and other surfaces. It is generally electrically driven. The dirt is collected by either a dustbag or a cyclone for later disposal. Vacuum cleaners, which are used in homes as well as in industry, exist in a variety of sizes and models. Specialized shop vacuums can be used to suck up both dust and liquids.
TEXT.Italian: Un aspirapolvere è un dispositivo che, tramite un processo di aspirazione, rimuove detriti da pavimenti, tappezzerie, tendaggi e altre superfici. È generalmente guidato elettricamente. Lo sporco viene raccolto in un sacchetto per la polvere o in un serbatoio per un successivo smaltimento. Gli aspirapolvere vengono utilizzati nelle case e nell'industria ed esistono in una varietà di dimensioni e modelli. Gli aspirapolvere specializzati possono essere utilizzati per aspirare sia polvere, sia liquidi.

TEXT.English: Vanilla is a flavoring derived from orchids of the genus Vanilla. Three major species of vanilla currently are grown globally, all of which derive from a species originally found in Mesoamerica. Flowers are greenish-yellow, with a diameter of 5 cm (2 in). They last only a day, and must be pollinated manually, during the morning, if a fruit is desired. Fruits are produced only on mature plants, which are generally over 3 m (10 ft) long. The fruits are 15-23 cm (6-9 in) long pods (often incorrectly called beans), and mature after about five months. Vanilla extract is obtained from this portion of the plant. Vanilla is the second-most expensive spice after saffron. Despite the expense, vanilla is highly valued for its flavor and is widely used in both commercial and domestic baking, perfume manufacture, and aromatherapy.
TEXT.Italian: La vaniglia è un aroma derivato dalle orchidee del genere Vanilla. Tre specie principali di vaniglia sono attualmente coltivate a livello globale, tutte derivate da una specie originariamente trovata in Mesoamerica. I fiori sono di colore giallo-verdastro, con un diametro di 5 cm. Durano solo un giorno e devono essere impollinati manualmente, al mattino, se si desidera un frutto. I frutti sono prodotti solo su piante mature, che sono generalmente lunghe più di 3 m. I frutti sono baccelli lunghi 15-23 cm e maturano dopo circa cinque mesi. L'estratto di vaniglia è ottenuto da questa porzione della pianta. La vaniglia è la seconda spezia più costosa dopo lo zafferano. Nonostante l'alto costo, la vaniglia è molto apprezzata per il suo sapore ed è ampiamente usata nella cottura commerciale e domestica, nella produzione di profumi e nell'aromaterapia.

TEXT.English: Vegetables are parts of plants that are consumed by humans or other animals as food. The original meaning of the term is still used to refer to all edible plant matter, including the flowers, fruits, stems, leaves, roots, and seeds. Originally, vegetables were collected from the wild by hunter-gatherers, and entered cultivation in several parts of the world, probably during the period 10,000-7,000 BC. Vegetables can be eaten either raw or cooked and play an important role in human nutrition, being mostly low in fat and carbohydrates, but high in vitamins, minerals and dietary fiber.
TEXT.Italian: Le verdure sono parti di piante che vengono consumate dall'uomo o da altri animali come cibo. Il significato originale del termine è ancora usato per indicare tutta la materia vegetale commestibile, inclusi fiori, frutti, steli, foglie, radici e semi. Le verdure venivano inizialmente raccolte selvatiche dai cacciatori-raccoglitori; la loro coltivazione iniziò, in diverse parti del mondo, probabilmente durante il periodo 10.000-7.000 a.C. Le verdure possono essere consumate crude o cotte e svolgono un ruolo importante nell'alimentazione umana, essendo principalmente a basso contenuto di grassi e carboidrati, ma ad alto contenuto di vitamine, minerali e fibre alimentari.

TEXT.English: Vibranium is a rare metallic substance of extraterrestrial origin. It was brought to Earth by a meteorite hit 10,000 years ago, and at the moment there are two known versions: the most common one is the so-called "Wakandan vibranium", that possesses the ability to absorb, store, and release large amounts of kinetic energy; the other one is the Antarctic vibrianium that produces vibrations of a specific wavelength that break down the molecular bonds in other metals, causing them to liquefy.
TEXT.Italian: Il vibranio è una rara sostanza metallica di origine extraterrestre. È stato portato sulla Terra da un meteorite colpito 10.000 anni fa e al momento ci sono due versioni conosciute: la più comune è il cosiddetto "vibranio di Wakanda", che possiede la capacità di assorbire, immagazzinare e rilasciare grandi quantità di energia cinetica; l'altro è il vibrianio antartico, che produce vibrazioni su una lunghezza d'onda specifica capaci di rompere i legami molecolari in altri metalli, provocandone la liquefazione.

TEXT.English: A video game is an electronic game that involves interaction with a user interface to generate visual feedback on a two- or three-dimensional video display device such as a touchscreen, virtual reality headset or monitor/TV set. Since the 1980s, video games have become an increasingly important part of the entertainment industry, and whether they are also a form of art is a matter of dispute. The electronic systems used to play video games are called platforms. Video games are developed and released for one or several platforms and may not be available on others.
TEXT.Italian: Un videogioco è un gioco elettronico che prevede l'interazione con un'interfaccia utente per generare feedback visivi su un dispositivo di visualizzazione video bidimensionale o tridimensionale come un touchscreen, un visore per realtà virtuale, un monitor o un televisore. Dagli anni ottanta del XX secolo, i videogiochi sono diventati una parte sempre più importante dell'industria dell'intrattenimento, al punto che si discute se considerarli anche una forma d'arte. I sistemi elettronici utilizzati per giocare ai videogiochi sono chiamati piattaforme. I videogiochi sono sviluppati e rilasciati per una o più piattaforme e potrebbero non essere disponibili su altre.

TEXT.English: A vine is any plant with a growth habit of trailing or climbing stems, lianas or runners. Long stems serve two purposes: vine may use rock exposures, other plants, or other supports for growth rather than investing energy in a lot of supportive tissue, enabling the plant to reach sunlight with a minimum investment of energy. It may also enable plants to colonize large areas quickly, even without climbing high. Many vines are widely cultivated as an ornamental plant or used in pharmaceutical sector.
TEXT.Italian: Una vite è qualsiasi pianta che cresce attraverso lunghi gambi, liane o rampicanti. Gli steli lunghi hanno due scopi: la vite può usare esposizioni rocciose, altre piante o altri supporti per la crescita, piuttosto che investire energia in molti tessuti di supporto, consentendo alla pianta di raggiungere la luce solare con un investimento minimo di energia; questo consente alle piante anche di colonizzare rapidamente grandi aree, anche senza arrampicarsi in alto. Molte viti sono ampiamente coltivate come pianta ornamentale o utilizzate nel settore farmaceutico.

TEXT.English: A vintage wine is a wine made from grapes that were all, or primarily, grown and harvested in a single specified year. Wines of superior vintages, from prestigious producers and regions, will often command much higher prices than those from average vintages. This is especially the case if wines are likely to improve further with some age in the bottle. A common, though not strictly correct, usage applies the term to any wine that is perceived to be particularly old or of a particularly high quality.
TEXT.Italian: Un vino d'annata è un vino ottenuto da uve che sono state tutte, o per la maggioranza, coltivate e raccolte in una determinata annata. I vini di annate superiori, provenienti da produttori e regioni prestigiose, hanno spesso prezzi molto più alti di quelli delle annate medie. Ciò è particolarmente vero per i vini che migliorano con un certo invecchiamento in bottiglia. Un uso comune, sebbene non strettamente corretto, del termine lo estende a qualsiasi vino che viene percepito come particolarmente vecchio o di qualità particolarmente elevata.

TEXT.English: Vulcanized rubber is a chemically processed rubber. The term "vulcanization" traditionally referred to the treatment of natural rubber with sulfur in order to harden it, then with time grew to include also hardening of other (synthetic) rubbers via various means. Vulcanization works by forming cross-links between sections of polymer chain which results in increased rigidity and durability, as well as other changes in the mechanical and electrical properties of the material.
TEXT.Italian: La gomma vulcanizzata è una gomma trattata chimicamente. Il termine "vulcanizzazione" si riferiva tradizionalmente al trattamento della gomma naturale con lo zolfo per indurirla, poi con il tempo è stato esteso per includere anche il processo di indurimento di altre gomme (sintetiche) attraverso vari mezzi. La vulcanizzazione agisce formando collegamenti incrociati tra le sezioni della catena polimerica, che si traducono in una maggiore rigidità e durata, nonché in altri cambiamenti nelle proprietà meccaniche ed elettriche del materiale.

TEXT.English: The walrus (Odobenus rosmarus) is a large flippered marine mammal with a discontinuous distribution about the North Pole in the Arctic Ocean and subarctic seas of the Northern Hemisphere. The walrus is the only living species in the family Odobenidae and genus Odobenus. This species is subdivided into two subspecies: the Atlantic walrus (O. r. rosmarus) which lives in the Atlantic Ocean and the Pacific walrus (O. r. divergens) which lives in the Pacific Ocean.
TEXT.Polish: Mors (łac. Odobenus rosmarus) - gatunek dużego drapieżnego ssaka morskiego, jedyny współcześnie żyjący przedstawiciel dawniej licznej w gatunki rodziny morsowatych (Odobenidae) i jedyny gatunek z rodzaju Odobenus. Mors pełnił ważną rolę w życiu mieszkańców Arktyki, którzy polowali na niego dla mięsa, skór, tłuszczu, kłów i kości.

TEXT.English: Wares are manufactured objects and items, made from different types of metals or materials. They serve a number of uses, depending on their material and their scope, such as tools, utensils, cookware, weapons, parts, pipes, etc.
TEXT.Italian: Questo tipo di oggetti vengono fabbricati e realizzati con diversi tipi di metalli o materiali. Possono servire per una serie di usi, a seconda del loro materiale e del loro scopo, come utensili, pentole, armi, parti, tubi, ecc.

TEXT.English: Warp drive is a faster-than-light (FTL) spacecraft propulsion system in many science fiction works, most notably Star Trek. A spacecraft equipped with a warp drive may travel at speeds greater than that of light by many orders of magnitude. In contrast to some other FTL technologies such as a jump drive or hyper drive, the warp drive does not permit instantaneous travel between two points but involves a measurable passage of time which is pertinent to the concept. Spacecraft at warp velocity theoretically continue to interact with objects in "normal space". The general concept of "warp drive" was introduced by John W. Campbell in his 1931 novel Islands of Space. Einstein's theory of special relativity states that energy and mass are interchangeable, thus, speed of light travel is impossible for material objects that weigh more than photons. The problem of a material object exceeding light speed is that an infinitely increasing amount of kinetic energy is required to attempt moving as fast as a massless photon. This problem can theoretically be solved by warping space to move an object instead of increasing the kinetic energy of the object to do so.

A washing machine (laundry machine, clothes washer, or washer) is a machine to wash laundry, such as clothing and sheets. The term is mostly applied only to machines that use water as opposed to dry cleaning (which uses alternative cleaning fluids, and is performed by specialist businesses) or ultrasonic cleaners. Washing entails immersing, dipping, rubbing, or scrubbing in water usually accompanied by detergent, or bleach. The simplest machines may simply agitate clothes in water while switched on; automatic machines may fill, empty, wash, spin, and heat in a cycle. Most washing machines remove substantial amounts of water from the laundry at the end of a wash cycle, but do not completely dry it.
TEXT.Polish: Suszarka do ubrań - współcześnie, ze względu na konstrukcję, zwane suszarką bębnową to urządzenie domowe lub profesjonalne służące do suszenia ubrań. Do takiej suszarki ubrania wkłada się do bębna, podobnie jak w pralce automatycznej, najczęściej po uprzednim ich upraniu.

TEXT.English: A water bottle is a container used to hold water for consumption. This allows an individual to transport or carry the bottled water from one place to another. A water bottle is usually made of plastic, glass, or metal, and so most can be recycled.
TEXT.Polish: Akratopega - woda podziemna, której mineralizacja wynosi 500-1000 mg/dm, a temperatura nie przekracza 20 C. W klasyfikacji wód ze względu na zawartość związków mineralnych znajduje się pomiędzy wodą słodką a mineralną. Produkowana jest w kilku rodzajach: silnie gazowana, gazowana, niegazowana, lekko gazowana oraz jako musująca Perlage.

TEXT.English: Waterproof cement is a composite material composed of fine and coarse aggregate bonded together with a fluid cement ("cement paste") that hardens over time, with the addition of crystalline admixtures during batching to lower permeability. The reaction takes place when exposed to water and un-hydrated cement particles to form insoluble needle-shaped crystals, which fill capillary pores and micro-cracks. The mixture can expect to self-seal as constant exposure to water will continuously initiate crystallization to ensure permanent waterproof protection.
TEXT.Italian: Il cemento impermeabile è un materiale composito fatto da aggregato fine e grossolano unito con un cemento fluido ("pasta di cemento") che si indurisce nel tempo, con l'aggiunta di additivi cristallini durante il dosaggio per ridurre la permeabilità. La reazione ha luogo quando acqua e particelle di cemento non idratate entrano in contatto, formando cristalli insolubili a forma di ago, che riempiono i pori e le micro-crepe. La mistura di fatto si autosigilla, poiché l'esposizione costante all'acqua avvia continuamente la cristallizzazione per garantire una protezione impermeabile permanente.

TEXT.English: The best known animal wax is beeswax, but other insects secrete waxes. A major component of beeswax is the ester myricyl palmitate substance which is used in constructing their honeycombs.
TEXT.Polish: Wosk pszczeli (wosk żółty, łac. Cera flava) - wydzielina gruczołów woskowych pszczół służąca im do budowania plastrów w ulu. Gruczoły woskowe pszczół znajdują się na spodniej części odwłoka pszczoły robotnicy. Produkcja wosku zależy od jej wieku. Największa jest w trzecim tygodniu życia pszczoły.

TEXT.English: In much later times whale oil was favoured for its cleaner burning flame.
TEXT.Italian: In tempi recenti l'olio di balena era molto usato per la sua fiamma più pulita.

TEXT.English: Whales are a widely distributed and diverse group of fully aquatic placental marine mammals. Whales are creatures of the open ocean: they feed, mate, give birth, suckle and raise their young at sea. Whales range in size from the 2.6 metres (8.5 ft) and 135 kilograms (298 lb) dwarf sperm whale to the 29.9 metres (98 ft) and 190 metric tons (210 short tons) blue whale, which is the largest known creature that has ever lived. Once relentlessly hunted for their products, whales are now protected by international law. Whales are typically hunted for their meat, blubber, bones (for tools), oil (for lamp fuel and lubricants), baleen (for corsets and skirt hoops), and ambergris (for fixative for perfumes).
TEXT.Italian: Le balene sono un gruppo ampiamente distribuito e diversificato di mammiferi marini placentare completamente acquatici. Le balene sono creature dell'oceano: si nutrono, si accoppiano, danno alla luce, allattano e allevano i loro piccoli in mare. Le balene variano in dimensione dai 2,6 metri e 135 chilogrammi del capodoglio nano ai 29,9 metri e 190 tonnellate delle balene blu, che sono le più grandi creature conosciute mai vissute. Una volta cacciate incessantemente per i loro prodotti, le balene sono ora protette dal diritto internazionale. Le balene sono in genere cacciate per la carne, il grasso, le ossa (per utensili), l'olio (per lampade e lubrificanti), il fanone (per corsetti e cerchietti per gonna) e l'ambra grigia (fissativo per profumi).

TEXT.English: Wheat has been a staple crop for civilizations occupying temperate zones of the planet since pre-historic times. There is archeological evidence that bread wheat was cultivated in southern Turkestan as early as 6000 BC, though naturally occurring wheat was probably used for food purposes much earlier. Throughout the temperate zones, wheat has become the primary food crop. It is particularly well suited for growth in vast, open plains like those found in the central United States.
TEXT.French: Le blé est une des principales ressources agricoles de nombreuses civilisations des régions tempérées, et ce depuis la Préhistoire. Il existe des traces archéologiques prouvant que le blé est cultivé au Sud du Turkestan depuis 6 000 ans av. J.-C., mais le blé sauvage est vraisemblablement consommé depuis plus longtemps. Dans les régions tempérées, le blé est le principal produit agricole alimentaire. Il est particulièrement bien adapté à la culture sur de grandes plaines ouvertes, comme celles du centre des Etats-Unis.
TEXT.German: Weizen ist ein Getreide aus der Familie der Süßgräser, dass schon zu prähistorischen Urzeiten von den in gemäßigten klimatischen Regionen beheimateten Völkern als Grundnahrungsmittel genutzt wurde. Archäologische Funde beweisen, dass man bereits 6000 v.Chr. im südlichen Turkistan Brotweizen anbaute, während wilder Weizen vermutlich schon viel früher als Nahrungsmittel verwendet wurde. In Gegenden mit gemäßigtem Klima ist Weizen die wichtigste landwirtschaftliche Feldfrucht überhaupt. Besonders gut gedeiht Weizen auf großen offenen Ebenen wie im Zentrum der Vereinigten Staaten.
TEXT.Italian: Il frumento è stato uno degli alimenti principali delle popolazioni residenti in zone temperate sin dalla preistoria. Esistono dei reperti archeologici che dimostrano che questo cereale veniva coltivato nel Turkistan già nel 6000 a.C., malgrado sia possibile che l'utilizzo del frumento non coltivato possa essere avvenuto molto prima. È particolarmente indicato per la coltivazioni in grandi pianure.
TEXT.Spanish: El trigo ha sido un cultivo básico para las civilizaciones que ocupaban zonas templadas del planeta desde la Prehistoria. Existen pruebas arqueológicas de que el trigo para hacer pan se cultivaba en el sur del Turkestán allá por el año 6000 a.C., aunque el trigo natural seguramente se usaba como alimento mucho antes. Se ha convertido en el principal cultivo en todas las regiones templadas. Está especialmente adaptado para su cultivo en grandes llanuras abiertas como las del centro de los Estados Unidos.

TEXT.English: A woodwind instrument is a musical instrument which produces sound when the player blows air against a sharp edge or through a reed, causing the air within its resonator (usually a column of air) to vibrate. Most of these instruments are made of wood but can be made of other materials, such as metals or plastics.
TEXT.Italian: Uno strumento a fuato è uno strumento musicale che produce suoni quando il musicista soffia attraverso un'apertura dello strumento, facendo vibrare l'aria all'interno della cassa di risonanza. La maggior parte di questi strumenti sono fatti in legno, ma possono essere costruiti anche in metallo o in plastica.
TEXT.Polish: Instrument dęty drewniany - instrument dęty, w którym wibratorem jest drewniany stroik, bądź krawędź, o którą rozpraszany jest strumień powietrza. Sam instrument może być wykonany z dowolnego materiału, np. drewna, metalu, lub tworzywa sztucznego. Zródłem dźwięku w instrumentach dętych drewnianych są wibracje powietrza, których częstotliwość (wysokość dźwięku) jest regulowana przez zakrywanie otworów w korpusie instrumentu. Ponieważ przykrywanie wielu otworów naraz byłoby trudne lub nawet niewykonalne, w wielu instrumentach dętych drewnianych stosuje się mechanizm klapkowy.

TEXT.English: Wood is a porous and fibrous structural tissue found in the stems and roots of trees and other woody plants. It is a natural composite of cellulose fibers that are strong in tension and embedded in a matrix of lignin that resists compression. In a living tree it performs a support function, enabling woody plants to grow large or to stand up by themselves. It also conveys water and nutrients between the leaves, other growing tissues, and the roots. Wood has been used for thousands of years for fuel, as a construction material, for making tools and weapons, furniture and paper. During 20th century, it emerged as a feedstock for the production of purified cellulose and its derivatives, such as cellophane and cellulose acetate.
TEXT.Italian: Il legno è un tessuto strutturale poroso e fibroso trovato negli steli e nelle radici di alberi e altre piante legnose. È un composito naturale di fibre di cellulosa in forte tensione e incorporato in una matrice di lignina che resiste alla compressione. In un albero vivente svolge una funzione di supporto, permettendo alle piante legnose di crescere grandi o di restare in piedi da sole. Trasmette anche acqua e sostanze nutritive tra le foglie, altri tessuti in crescita e le radici. Il legno è stato usato per migliaia di anni come combustibile, come materiale da costruzione e per fabbricare strumenti, armi, mobili e carta. Nel corso del XX secolo, è emerso come materia prima per la produzione di cellulosa purificata e suoi derivati, come cellophane e acetato di cellulosa.

TEXT.English: Wool is the textile fiber obtained from sheep and certain other animals, including cashmere from goats, mohair from goats, qiviut from muskoxen, angora from rabbits, and other types of wool from camelids. Wool has several qualities that distinguish it from hair or fur: it is crimped, it is elastic, and it grows in staples (clusters).
TEXT.Polish: Wełna - włókno naturalne uzyskiwane z okrywy włosowej (sierści) owiec, lam, wielbłądów, kóz, królików i innych. Włókno wełniane posiada charakterystyczne cechy (karbikowatość, łuskowatość, zawiera lanolinę), dzięki którym nadaje się doskonale do wytwarzania wysokiej jakości, wyrobów włókienniczych.

TEXT.English: A Yggdrasil seed can sprout a highly flexible, planet-spanning tree. They can rapidly accelerate terraforming in almost any planetary environment.
TEXT.Italian: Un seme di Yggdrasil può far germogliare alberi altamente flessibili che possono ricoprire un intero pianeta. Possono accelerare rapidamente la terraformazione in quasi tutti gli ambienti planetari.

TEXT.English: Zinc is a blue-silvery, slightly brittle metal. It is refined by froth flotation of the ore, roasting, and final extraction using electricity (electrowinning). Zinc is used, in various proportions, with copper to produce brass alloys. Corrosion-resistant zinc plating of iron is the major application for zinc, as well as in electrical batteries. It is also an essential mineral for humans, including to prenatal and postnatal development.
TEXT.Italian: Lo zinco è un metallo di colore blu-argenteo e leggermente fragile. Viene raffinato mediante la flottazione, la torrefazione e l'estrazione finale mediante elettricità (elettro-estrazione). Lo zinco viene utilizzato, in varie proporzioni, con il rame per produrre leghe di ottone. La zincatura del ferro a fini anti-corrosivi è l'applicazione principale per lo zinco, ma viene usato anche per le batterie elettriche. È anche un minerale essenziale per l'uomo, soprattutto durante lo sviluppo prenatale e postnatale.
